multiple-choice.question: Let $m \geq 5$ and $n \geq 5$ be integers. Let $P$ be a set consisting of $m$ strictly positive integers, and let $N$ be a set consisting of $n$ strictly negative integers. Consider 5-element subsets $A$ of $P \cup N$ such that the product of the elements in $A$ is strictly positive. How many such subsets $A$ are there?
